availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, carriage maker. Virginia native. Owner of Enders and Severson Carriage Makers in partnership with Stephen Severson. Coach trimmer in Louisville in 1850. Coach maker in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, p. 273A
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 9, p. 228A.
"All Goes to His Wife," Louisville Courier-Journal, 28 Nov 1891, 12. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
"Stephen Severson Dead. Was for Many Years a Prominent Carriage Manufacturer," Louisville Courier-Journal, 10 Mar 1895, 21, ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
